page.title: 16A Welcome in the Hillside
page.content: As a Yorkshire housewife contemplating a family move to West Wales many were the doubting Thomases giving warning of the hostility I would find. They will burn down your home, I was told. What a good thing we took no notice and what a warm welcome we received. It is now two years since our move and we have found extreme friendliness and good neighbourliness in dyfed. It is not an artificial olliness tht soon faes but a genuine awareness of the needs of other s ad an acceptance that we can each gain rom the other's friendship - a true community spirit.. Nor are we the only 'foreign' family to have found this welcome. People from other parts of Britain should refrain from listening to scaremongers and come and see from themselves - always keeping in mind they are coming to an old country with rich heritage.
